column4: Anyone willing to troubleshoot WOW + ATI Radeon 9800 Pro issues with me?

I am using Ubuntu 11.04
Then you should be asking in #ubuntu+1 or #radeon
What is the output of 'glxinfo|grep renderer'?
OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI R300 (R350 4E48) 20090101 x86/MMX+/3DNow!+/SSE TCL DRI2
You don't have gallium. Try installing libgl1-mesa-dri-experimental (and re-logging in)

Hopefully it will install the gallium driver which will allow for opengl 2.1
so that should fix the problem or there are more steps?
illusionz: First you want to get gallium working. If installing the experimental package doesn't work, you may need to install xorg-edgers repo first
i just installed what you told me to, restart and log back in?
Yea just log out and back in then show the output of 'glxinfo|grep renderer' again

You still don't have gallium. Try this: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:xorg-edgers/ppa && sudo apt-get update && && sudo apt-get upgrade
please stand by, still upgrading....
If it installs a kernel (which is likely), reboot the machine after it's finished
